Recipe.title: Navajo Fry Bread
Recipe.Description:
In the mid 1800's, the U.S. government was dealing with Navajo Indians by commandeering the women and children and marching them to a distant location. On the trip, they were given small allotments of flour, etc. From this, the mothers would mix up a dough and fry it in oil for their children.
There are several versions of this recipe, but this is the one that has worked best for us.

section.instruction: Mix together Flour, Baking Powder and Salt.
Add Milk and gently knead together.
Flatten each ball into a thin circle.
Fry on each side until golden brown.

Notes.note: Eating it plain isn't very pleasurable, so make sure to have Honey, Butter, Sauces: Honey Butter, Jam or something similar on hand.
For "Navajo Tacos" make regular taco fillings, but substitute these for the tortillas.
